title: Gemma Collins is accused by fans of Photoshopping her Instagram post
text:
She's been on a mission to lose weight this year and has already shed a staggering three stone.

And Gemma Collins, 38, showed off her hard work on Thursday - but some fans were left questioning whether the star had posted an edited image.

Replying to the GC's Instagram, some claimed the picture had been Photoshopped with other saying the floor and skirting boards were 'wonky'.

Edited? Gemma Collins, 38, has been accused by some fans of Photoshopping her Instagram post, with them suggesting the skirting board behind her legs is 'wonky'

Gemma is seen posing with one hand behind her head while wearing a snake-print co-ord lounge suit in the glam snap.

The reality TV star's blonde locks are down and she has pretty pearl clips in her tresses, as well as a full face of makeup including a touch of pink eye-shadow.

Dozens of people responded to the post, with many praising Gemma for her weight loss, but with others calling her out for possibly editing her figure.

Claims: Although praising Gemma for her weight loss, fans took to Instagram to suggest that the image had been edited

Different: One person said that Gemma didn't need to change her pictures to make it look like she'd lost more weight

One person wrote: 'I applaud you on your weight loss but photoshopping not only deceives others but ultimately yourself ..

'Skirting board is wonky behind legs and shadow doesn't look right, am I the only one seeing this?'

While someone else commented: 'Got a bit of a wobbly floor going on there. Please don't edit your photos. You have lost loads of weight. Do not need to make out you have lost more.'

Filming: Gemma was seen wearing leather leggings and a Gucci-inspired jumper while filming The Only Way Is Essex on Wednesday

Denied: Stylish Lucas Armitage said he edited the image but did not change Gemma's shape

Others said it was 'obvious Gemma is deceiving her fans by airbrushing her pictures' and another said 'weight loss of filter'.

However stylish Lucas Armitage, who said he took the picture and did the edit, said that he had not changed Gemma's shape in the picture.

Gemma's manager has been contacted for comment by MailOnline.

The TV personality recently revealed that she hasn't stopped eating since she reportedly called 999 over fears her on-off boyfriend James Argent had overdosed.

The star admitted she was feeling stressed but vowed to bounce back and return to the gym.

Airbrushed? One fan asked if Gemma was still changing her snaps, hinting at previous times the star has been called out for editing

Edit: Some were convinced that the picture was Photoshopped before being uploaded

Not convinced: Some said they didn't think Gemma was really how she appeared in the snap

Changed: A couple of people claimed that Gemma was 'deceiving' her fans by editing snaps

Gemma told The Sun: 'I ain’t stopped eating. I’ve had a lot of stress and I’ve not been to the gym in two weeks, I’ve been unwell all weekend with a chest infection.

'When I come back, I will get back on it, I always come out on top. 'My life always goes a bit t*ts-up but I carry on, I’ve got lots of projects on the table, so it’s exciting.'

Back in April Gemma was accused of Photoshopping images to market her clothing range.

On a mission: Gemma, pictured last Thursday, has already dropped three stone in weight

It was revealed that she could be facing legal action after her head was placed on a model's digitally-enlarged body, in order to promote her clothing collection and put online, leaving model Katie Green, 30, 'furious'.

A day later, The Sun report a second model, Kate Louise Smith, 37, had come forward after reportedly being used for the same purpose, as she said: 'Rather than being mortified, I’m just insulted. It’s very intrusive and it’s an odd thing to do.'

According to the Daily Star, model Katie was furious to discover the poorly Photoshopped images and has sought legal advice.

Yet a spokesperson for Gemma told MailOnline at the time: 'The images were used in good faith by Gemma. An external firm assured her that they owned the copyright and had commissioned the shoots.'
description: Gemma Collins, 38, shared a snap of herself in a snake-print co-ord on Thursday but some fans claimed it had been edited, saying the: 'Skirting board is wonky behind legs and shadow doesn't look right.'
